The `writeFormatted()` function at line 384-388 handles all plain text output formatting.\n\n---\n\n## 2. Provides a unified interface for displaying output in different modes:\n//! - plain: No colors, basic formatting (default for non-TTY)\n//! - rich: Colors and formatting (default for TTY)\n//! - json: Structured JSON output for machine consumption\n//! - quiet: Minimal output (IDs only)\n//!\n//! Respects NO_COLOR environment variable and --no-color flag.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Status = models.Status;\nconst Priority = models.Priority;\nconst IssueType = models.IssueType;\n\n/// Output mode determines formatting and verbosity.\npub const OutputMode = enum {\n    plain, // No colors, basic formatting\n    rich, // Colors and formatting (TTY)\n    json, // Structured JSON output\n    quiet, // Minimal output (IDs only)\n};\n\n/// ANSI color escape codes.\npub const Color = struct {\n    pub const reset = \"\\x1b[0m\";\n    pub const bold = \"\\x1b[1m\";\n    pub const dim = \"\\x1b[2m\";\n    pub const italic = \"\\x1b[3m\";\n    pub const underline = \"\\x1b[4m\";\n\n    pub const red = \"\\x1b[31m\";\n    pub const green = \"\\x1b[32m\";\n    pub const yellow = \"\\x1b[33m\";\n    pub const blue = \"\\x1b[34m\";\n    pub const magenta = \"\\x1b[35m\";\n    pub const cyan = \"\\x1b[36m\";\n    pub const white = \"\\x1b[37m\";\n    pub const gray = \"\\x1b[90m\";\n\n    pub const bright_red = \"\\x1b[91m\";\n    pub const bright_green = \"\\x1b[92m\";\n    pub const bright_yellow = \"\\x1b[93m\";\n    pub const bright_blue = \"\\x1b[94m\";\n    pub const bright_magenta = \"\\x1b[95m\";\n    pub const bright_cyan = \"\\x1b[96m\";\n\n    pub const bg_red = \"\\x1b[41m\";\n    pub const bg_green = \"\\x1b[42m\";\n    pub const bg_yellow = \"\\x1b[43m\";\n    pub const bg_blue = \"\\x1b[44m\";\n};\n\n/// Global options that affect output formatting.\n/// This mirrors the relevant fields from cli.args.GlobalOptions.\npub const OutputOptions = struct {\n    json: bool = false,\n    toon: bool = false,\n    quiet: bool = false,\n    silent: bool = false, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    no_color: bool = false,\n    wrap: bool = false, // Wrap long lines in plain text output\n    stats: bool = false, // Show token savings stats for TOON output\n};\n\n/// Output formatter for consistent CLI output across all modes.\npub const Output = struct {\n    mode: OutputMode,\n    toon: bool,\n    silent: bool, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    wrap: bool, // Wrap long lines in plain text output\n    stats: bool, // Show token savings stats for TOON output\n    stdout: std.fs.File,\n    stderr: std.fs.File,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    /// Terminal width for line wrapping (default: 80)\n    terminal_width: usize = 80,\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Initialize output formatter based on global options and TTY detection.\n    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, opts: OutputOptions) Self {\n        const stdout = std.fs.File.stdout();\n        const stderr = std.fs.File.stderr();\n\n        var mode: OutputMode = .plain;\n        if (opts.json or opts.toon) {\n            mode = .json;\n        } else if (opts.quiet or opts.silent) {\n            mode = .quiet;\n        } else if (!opts.no_color and !checkNoColorEnv() and stdout.isTty()) {\n            mode = .rich;\n        }\n\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = opts.toon,\n            .silent = opts.silent,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with explicit mode (useful for testing).\n    pub fn initWithMode(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = false,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize for testing with custom file handles.\n    pub fn initForTesting(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode, stdout: std.fs.File, stderr: std.fs.File) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = false,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with silent mode (suppresses ALL output including errors).\n    pub fn initSilent(allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = .quiet,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = true,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n        };\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Issue Display\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a single issue in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssue(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueJson(issue),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueQuiet(issue),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueRich(issue),\n            .plain => try self.printIssuePlain(issue),\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Print a list of issues in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssueList(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueListJson(issues),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueListQuiet(issues),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueListRich(issues),\n            .plain => try self.printIssueListPlain(issues),\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Generic Messages\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout.\n    pub fn print(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout with newline.\n    pub fn println(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt ++ \"\\n\", args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a success message (green in rich mode).\n    pub fn success(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.green);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an error message to stderr (red in rich mode).\n    pub fn err(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.silent) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.red);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"error: \" ++ fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print a warning message to stderr (yellow in rich mode).\n    pub fn warn(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.silent or self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.yellow);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"warning: \" ++ fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an info message (cyan in rich mode).\n    pub fn info(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.cyan);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw bytes to stdout (bypasses mode checks).\n    pub fn raw(self: *Self, bytes: []const u8) !void {\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(bytes);\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw JSON value to stdout (for JSON mode).\n    /// If toon mode is enabled, converts JSON to TOON format for reduced token usage.\n    pub fn printJson(self: *Self, value: anytype) !void {\n        const json_bytes = try std.json.Stringify.valueAlloc(self.allocator, value, .{});\n        defer self.allocator.free(json_bytes);\n\n        if (self.toon) {\n            const toon = @import(\"toon_zig\");\n            const toon_bytes = toon.jsonToToon(self.allocator, json_bytes) catch |convert_err| {\n                try self.stderr.writeAll(\"error: failed to convert to TOON format\\n\");\n                return convert_err;\n            };\n            defer self.allocator.free(toon_bytes);\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(toon_bytes);\n        } else {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(json_bytes);\n        }\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // JSON Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssueJson(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        try self.printJson(issue);\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListJson(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        try self.printJson(issues);\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Plain Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssuePlain(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"ID: {s}\\n\", .{issue.id});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Title: {s}\\n\", .{issue.title});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Status: {s}\\n\", .{issue.status.toString()});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Priority: {s}\\n\", .{issue.priority.toString()});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Type: {s}\\n\", .{issue.issue_type.toString()});\n\n        if (issue.description) |desc| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"Description: {s}\\n\", .{desc});\n        }\n        if (issue.assignee) |assignee| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"Assignee: {s}\\n\", .{assignee});\n        }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\", \");\n                try self.stdout.writeAll(label);\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n        if (issue.due_at.value) |due| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"Due: {d}\\n\", .{due});\n        }\n\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Created: {d}\\n\", .{issue.created_at.value});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Updated: {d}\\n\", .{issue.updated_at.value});\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListPlain(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            const status_abbrev = abbreviateStatus(issue.status);\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}  [{s}] {s}\\n\", .{\n                issue.id,\n                status_abbrev,\n                issue.title,\n            });\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Rich Mode Helpers (ANSI colors)\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssueRich(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        // Bold ID\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.bold, issue.id, Color.reset });\n\n        // Title\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  {s}\\n\", .{issue.title});\n\n        // Status with color\n        const status_color = getStatusColor(issue.status);\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Status: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ status_color, issue.status.toString(), Color.reset });\n\n        // Priority with color\n        const priority_color = getPriorityColor(issue.priority);\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Priority: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ priority_color, issue.priority.toString(), Color.reset });\n\n        // Type\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Type: {s}\\n\", .{issue.issue_type.toString()});\n\n        // Optional fields\n        if (issue.description) |desc| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"  Description: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.dim, desc, Color.reset });\n        }\n        if (issue.assignee) |assignee| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"  Assignee: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.cyan, assignee, Color.reset });\n        }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"  Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\", \");\n                try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}\", .{ Color.magenta, label, Color.reset });\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListRich(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            const status_color = getStatusColor(issue.status);\n            const priority_color = getPriorityColor(issue.priority);\n            const status_abbrev = abbreviateStatus(issue.status);\n\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}  {s}[{s}]{s}  {s}{s}{s}  {s}\\n\", .{\n                Color.bold,\n                issue.id,\n                Color.reset,\n                status_color,\n                status_abbrev,\n                Color.reset,\n                priority_color,\n                priorityIndicator(issue.priority),\n                Color.reset,\n                issue.title,\n            });\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Quiet Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssueQuiet(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}\\n\", .{issue.id});\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListQuiet(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}\\n\", .{issue.id});\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Internal Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn writeFormatted(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // CSV Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Available fields for CSV output.\n    pub const CsvField = enum {\n        id,\n        title,\n        status,\n        priority,\n        issue_type,\n        assignee,\n        owner,\n        description,\n        created_at,\n        updated_at,\n        due_at,\n        labels,\n\n        pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) ?CsvField {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"id\")) return .id;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"title\")) return .title;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"status\")) return .status;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"priority\")) return .priority;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"type\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"issue_type\")) return .issue_type;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"assignee\")) return .assignee;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"owner\")) return .owner;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"description\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"desc\")) return .description;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"created_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"created\")) return .created_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"updated_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"updated\")) return .updated_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"due_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"due\")) return .due_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"labels\")) return .labels;\n            return null;\n        }\n\n        pub fn toString(self: CsvField) []const u8 {\n            return switch (self) {\n                .id => \"id\",\n                .title => \"title\",\n                .status => \"status\",\n                .priority => \"priority\",\n                .issue_type => \"type\",\n                .assignee => \"assignee\",\n                .owner => \"owner\",\n                .description => \"description\",\n                .created_at => \"created_at\",\n                .updated_at => \"updated_at\",\n                .due_at => \"due_at\",\n                .labels => \"labels\",\n            };\n        }\n    };\n\n    /// Default fields for CSV output.\n    pub const default_csv_fields = [_]CsvField{ .id, .title, .status, .priority };\n\n    /// Parse a comma-separated field list into CsvField array.\n    pub fn parseCsvFields(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, fields_str: ?[]const u8) ![]const CsvField {\n        if (fields_str) |str| {\n            var fields: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(CsvField) = .{};\n            errdefer fields.deinit(allocator);\n\n            var it = std.mem.splitSequence(u8, str, \",\");\n            while (it.next()) |field_name| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, field_name, \" \");\n                if (CsvField.fromString(trimmed)) |field| {\n                    try fields.append(allocator, field);\n                }\n            }\n\n            if (fields.items.len == 0) {\n                return &default_csv_fields;\n            }\n            return fields.toOwnedSlice(allocator);\n        }\n        return &default_csv_fields;\n    }\n\n    /// Print a list of issues in CSV format.\n    pub fn printIssueListCsv(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue, fields: []const CsvField) !void {\n        // Write header\n        for (fields, 0..) |field, i| {\n            if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\",\");\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(field.toString());\n        }\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n\n        // Write data rows\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            for (fields, 0..) |field, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\",\");\n                try self.writeCsvField(issue, field);\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    fn writeCsvField(self: *Self, issue: Issue, field: CsvField) !void {\n        switch (field) {\n            .id => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.id),\n            .title => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.title),\n            .status => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.status.toString()),\n            .priority => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.priority.toString()),\n            .issue_type => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.issue_type.toString()),\n            .assignee => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.assignee orelse \"\"),\n            .owner => try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an info message (cyan in rich mode).\n    pub fn info(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw bytes to stdout (bypasses mode checks).\n    pub fn raw(self: *Self, bytes: []const u8) !void {\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(bytes);\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw JSON value to stdout (for JSON mode).\n    /// If toon mode is enabled, converts JSON to TOON format for reduced token usage.\n    pub fn printJson(self: *Self, value: anytype) try self.stdout.writeAll(json_bytes);\n        }\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // JSON Mode self.writeFormatted(\"Priority: {s}\\n\", .{issue.priority.toString()});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Type: {s}\\n\", .{issue.issue_type.toString()});\n\n        if (issue.description) |desc| .{assignee});\n        }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try        try self.writeFormatted(\"Due: {d}\\n\", .{due});\n        }\n\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Created: {d}\\n\", .{issue.created_at.value});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Updated: {d}\\n\", .{issue.updated_at.value});\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListPlain(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            const status_abbrev = });\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Rich Mode Helpers (ANSI colors)\n    //    const status_color = getStatusColor(issue.status);\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Status: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ status_color, issue.status.toString(), Color.reset });\n\n        // Priority with color\n        const priority_color = getPriorityColor(issue.priority);\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Priority: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ priority_color, issue.priority.toString(), Color.reset });\n\n        // Type\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Type: {s}\\n\", .{issue.issue_type.toString()});\n\n        // Optional fields\n        if (issue.description) |desc| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"  Description: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.dim, desc, Color.reset });\n        }\n        if (issue.assignee) |assignee| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"  Assignee: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.cyan, assignee, Color.reset });\n        }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"  Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\", \");\n                try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}\", .{ Color.magenta, label, Color.reset });\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListRich(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            const status_color = self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}  {s}[{s}]{s}  {s}{s}{s}  {s}\\n\", .{\n                Color.bold,\n                issue.id,\n                Color.reset,\n                status_color,\n      });\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Quiet Mode Helpers\n    // }\n\n    fn printIssueListQuiet(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}\\n\", .{issue.id});\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Internal Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn writeFormatted(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // CSV Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Available fields for CSV output.\n    pub const CsvField = enum {\n        id,\n        title,\n        status,\n        priority,\n        issue_type,\n        assignee,\n        owner,\n        description,\n        created_at,\n        updated_at,\n        due_at,\n        labels,\n\n        pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) ?CsvField {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"id\")) return .id;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"title\")) return .title;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"status\")) return .status;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"priority\")) return .priority;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"type\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"issue_type\")) return .issue_type;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"assignee\")) return .assignee;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"owner\")) return .owner;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"description\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"desc\")) return .description;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"created_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"created\")) return .created_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"updated_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"updated\")) return .updated_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"due_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"due\")) return .due_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"labels\")) return .labels;\n            return null;\n        }\n\n        pub fn toString(self: CsvField) []const u8 {\n            return switch (self) {\n                .id => \"id\",\n                .title => \"title\",\n                .status => \"status\",\n                .priority => \"priority\",\n                .issue_type => \"type\",\n                .assignee => \"assignee\",\n                .owner => \"owner\",\n                .description => \"description\",\n                .created_at => \"created_at\",\n                .updated_at => \"updated_at\",\n                .due_at => \"due_at\",\n                .labels => \"labels\",\n            };\n        }\n    };\n\n    /// Default fields for CSV output.\n    pub const default_csv_fields = [_]CsvField{ .id, .title, .status, .priority };\n\n    /// Parse a comma-separated field list into CsvField array.\n    pub fn parseCsvFields(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, fields_str: ?[]const u8) ![]const CsvField {\n        if (fields_str) |str| {\n            var fields: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(CsvField) = .{};\n            errdefer fields.deinit(allocator);\n\n            var it = std.mem.splitSequence(u8, str, \",\");\n            while (it.next()) |field_name| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, field_name, \" \");\n                if (CsvField.fromString(trimmed)) |field| {\n                    try fields.append(allocator, field);\n                }\n            }\n\n            if (fields.items.len == 0) {\n                return &default_csv_fields;\n            }\n            return fields.toOwnedSlice(allocator);\n        }\n        return &default_csv_fields;\n    }\n\n    /// Print a list of issues in CSV format.\n    pub fn printIssueListCsv(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue, fields: []const CsvField) !void {\n        // Write header\n        for (fields, 0..) |field, i| {\n            if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\",\");\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(field.toString());\n        }\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n\n        // Write data rows\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            for (fields, 0..) |field, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\",\");\n                try self.writeCsvField(issue, field);\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    fn writeCsvField(self: *Self, issue: Issue, field: CsvField) !void {\n        switch (field) {\n            .id => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.id),\n            .title => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.title),\n            .status => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.status.toString()),\n            .priority => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.priority.toString()),\n            .issue_type => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.issue_type.toString()),\n            .assignee => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.assignee orelse \"\"),\n            .owner => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.owner orelse \"\"),\n            .description => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.description orelse \"\"),\n            .created_at => {\n                const ts = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"{d}\", .{issue.created_at.value});\n                defer self.allocator.free(ts);\n                try self.writeCsvValue(ts);\n            },\n            .updated_at => {\n                const ts = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"{d}\", .{issue.updated_at.value});\n                defer self.allocator.free(ts);\n                try self.writeCsvValue(ts);\n            },\n            .due_at => {\n                if (issue.due_at.value) |due| {\n                    const ts = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"{d}\", .{due});\n                    defer self.allocator.free(ts);\n                    try self.writeCsvValue(ts);\n                }\n            },\n            .labels => {\n                if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n                    const joined = try std.mem.join(self.allocator, \";\", issue.labels);\n                    defer self.allocator.free(joined);\n                    try self.writeCsvValue(joined);\n                }\n            },\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Write a CSV value with proper escaping.\n    fn writeCsvValue(self: *Self, value: []const u8) !void {\n        // Check if escaping is needed (contains comma, quote, or newline)\n        const needs_quoting = std.mem.indexOfAny(u8, value, \",\\\"\\n\\r\") != null;\n\n        if (needs_quoting) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\\"\");\n            for (value) |c| {\n                if (c == '\"') {\n                    try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\\"\\\"\");\n                } else {\n                    try self.stdout.writeAll(&[_]u8{c});\n                }\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\\"\");\n        } else {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(value);\n        }\n    }\n};\n\n// ============================================================================\n// Helper Functions\n// .quiet;\n        } else if (!opts.no_color and !checkNoColorEnv() and stdout.isTty()) {\n            mode = .rich;\n        }\n\n        // Try to get terminal width, default to 80\n        const terminal_width: usize = getTerminalWidth() orelse 80;\n\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = opts.toon,\n            .silent = opts.silent,\n            .wrap = opts.wrap,\n            .stats = opts.stats,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = terminal_width,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with explicit mode (useful for testing).\n    pub fn initWithMode(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize for testing with custom file handles.\n    pub fn .silent = false,\n            .wrap = false,\n            .stats = false,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with silent mode (suppresses ALL output including errors).\n    pub fn initSilent(allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = .quiet,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = true,\n            .wrap = false,\n            .stats = false,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Issue Display\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a single issue in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssue(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueJson(issue),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueQuiet(issue),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueRich(issue),\n            .plain => try self.printIssuePlain(issue),\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Print a list of issues in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssueList(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueListJson(issues),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueListQuiet(issues),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueListRich(issues),\n            .plain => try self.printIssueListPlain(issues),\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Generic Messages\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout.\n    pub fn print(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout with newline.\n    pub fn println(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt ++ \"\\n\", args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a success message (green in rich mode).\n    pub fn success(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.green);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an error message to stderr (red in rich mode).\n    pub fn err(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.silent) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.red);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"error: \" ++ fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print a warning message to stderr (yellow in rich mode).\n    pub fn warn(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.silent or self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.yellow);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"warning: \" ++ fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an info message (cyan in rich mode).\n    pub fn info(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.cyan);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw bytes to stdout (bypasses mode checks).\n    pub fn raw(self: *Self, bytes: []const u8) !void {\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(bytes);\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw JSON value to stdout (for JSON mode).\n    /// If toon mode is enabled, converts JSON to TOON format for reduced token usage.\n    pub fn printJson(self: *Self, value: anytype) !void {\n        const json_bytes = try std.json.Stringify.valueAlloc(self.allocator, value, .{});\n        defer self.allocator.free(json_bytes);\n\n        if (self.toon) {\n            const toon = @import(\"toon_zig\");\n            const toon_bytes = toon.jsonToToon(self.allocator, json_bytes) catch |convert_err| {\n                try self.stderr.writeAll(\"error: failed to convert to TOON format\\n\");\n                return convert_err;\n            };\n            defer self.allocator.free(toon_bytes);\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(toon_bytes);\n        } else {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(json_bytes);\n        }\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // JSON Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssueJson(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        try self.printJson(issue);\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListJson(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        try self.printJson(issues);\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Plain Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssuePlain(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"ID: {s}\\n\", .{issue.id});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Title: {s}\\n\", .{issue.title});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Status: {s}\\n\", .{issue.status.toString()});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Priority: {s}\\n\", .{issue.priority.toString()});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Type: {s}\\n\", .{issue.issue_type.toString()});\n\n        if (issue.description) |desc| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"Description: {s}\\n\", .{desc});\n        }\n        if (issue.assignee) |assignee| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"Assignee: {s}\\n\", .{assignee});\n        }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\", \");\n                try self.stdout.writeAll(label);\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n        if (issue.due_at.value) |due| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"Due: {d}\\n\", .{due});\n        }\n\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Created: {d}\\n\", .{issue.created_at.value});\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"Updated: {d}\\n\", .{issue.updated_at.value});\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListPlain(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            const status_abbrev = abbreviateStatus(issue.status);\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}  [{s}] {s}\\n\", .{\n                issue.id,\n                status_abbrev,\n                issue.title,\n            });\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Rich Mode Helpers (ANSI colors)\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssueRich(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        // Bold ID\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.bold, issue.id, Color.reset });\n\n        // Title\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  {s}\\n\", .{issue.title});\n\n        // Status with color\n        const status_color = getStatusColor(issue.status);\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Status: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ status_color, issue.status.toString(), Color.reset });\n\n        // Priority with color\n        const priority_color = getPriorityColor(issue.priority);\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Priority: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ priority_color, issue.priority.toString(), Color.reset });\n\n        // Type\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"  Type: {s}\\n\", .{issue.issue_type.toString()});\n\n        // Optional fields\n        if (issue.description) |desc| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"  Description: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.dim, desc, Color.reset });\n        }\n        if (issue.assignee) |assignee| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"  Assignee: {s}{s}{s}\\n\", .{ Color.cyan, assignee, Color.reset });\n        }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"  Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\", \");\n                try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}\", .{ Color.magenta, label, Color.reset });\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListRich(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            const status_color = getStatusColor(issue.status);\n            const priority_color = getPriorityColor(issue.priority);\n            const status_abbrev = abbreviateStatus(issue.status);\n\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}{s}{s}  {s}[{s}]{s}  {s}{s}{s}  {s}\\n\", .{\n                Color.bold,\n                issue.id,\n                Color.reset,\n                status_color,\n                status_abbrev,\n                Color.reset,\n                priority_color,\n                priorityIndicator(issue.priority),\n                Color.reset,\n                issue.title,\n            });\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Quiet Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn printIssueQuiet(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}\\n\", .{issue.id});\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListQuiet(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            try self.writeFormatted(\"{s}\\n\", .{issue.id});\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Internal Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    fn writeFormatted(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // CSV Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Available fields for CSV output.\n    pub const CsvField = enum {\n        id,\n        title,\n        status,\n        priority,\n        issue_type,\n        assignee,\n        owner,\n        description,\n        created_at,\n        updated_at,\n        due_at,\n        labels,\n\n        pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) ?CsvField {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"id\")) return .id;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"title\")) return .title;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"status\")) return .status;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"priority\")) return .priority;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"type\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"issue_type\")) return .issue_type;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"assignee\")) return .assignee;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"owner\")) return .owner;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"description\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"desc\")) return .description;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"created_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"created\")) return .created_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"updated_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"updated\")) return .updated_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"due_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"due\")) return .due_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"labels\")) return .labels;\n            return null;\n        }\n\n        pub fn toString(self: CsvField) []const u8 {\n            return switch (self) {\n                .id => \"id\",\n                .title => \"title\",\n                .status => \"status\",\n                .priority => \"priority\",\n                .issue_type => \"type\",\n                .assignee => \"assignee\",\n                .owner => \"owner\",\n                .description => \"description\",\n                .created_at => \"created_at\",\n                .updated_at => \"updated_at\",\n                .due_at => \"due_at\",\n                .labels => \"labels\",\n            };\n        }\n    };\n\n    /// Default fields for CSV output.\n    pub const default_csv_fields = [_]CsvField{ .id, .title, .status, .priority };\n\n    /// Parse a comma-separated field list into CsvField array.\n    pub fn parseCsvFields(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, fields_str: ?[]const u8) ![]const CsvField {\n        if (fields_str) |str| {\n            var fields: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(CsvField) = .{};\n            errdefer fields.deinit(allocator);\n\n            var it = std.mem.splitSequence(u8, str, \",\");\n            while (it.next()) |field_name| {\n                const trimmed = std.mem.trim(u8, field_name, \" \");\n                if (CsvField.fromString(trimmed)) |field| {\n                    try fields.append(allocator, field);\n                }\n            }\n\n            if (fields.items.len == 0) {\n                return &default_csv_fields;\n            }\n            return fields.toOwnedSlice(allocator);\n        }\n        return &default_csv_fields;\n    }\n\n    /// Print a list of issues in CSV format.\n    pub fn printIssueListCsv(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue, fields: []const CsvField) !void {\n        // Write header\n        for (fields, 0..) |field, i| {\n            if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\",\");\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(field.toString());\n        }\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n\n        // Write data rows\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            for (fields, 0..) |field, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\",\");\n                try self.writeCsvField(issue, field);\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    fn writeCsvField(self: *Self, issue: Issue, field: CsvField) !void {\n        switch (field) {\n            .id => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.id),\n            .title => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.title),\n            .status => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.status.toString()),\n            .priority => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.priority.toString()),\n            .issue_type => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.issue_type.toString()),\n            .assignee => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.assignee orelse \"\"),\n            .owner => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.owner orelse \"\"),\n            .description => try self.writeCsvValue(issue.description orelse \"\"),\n            .created_at => {\n                const ts = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"{d}\", .{issue.created_at.value});\n                defer self.allocator.free(ts);\n                try self.writeCsvValue(ts);\n            },\n            .updated_at => {\n                const ts = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"{d}\", .{issue.updated_at.value});\n                defer self.allocator.free(ts);\n                try self.writeCsvValue(ts);\n            },\n            .due_at => {\n                if (issue.due_at.value) |due| {\n                    const ts = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"{d}\", .{due});\n                    defer self.allocator.free(ts);\n                    try self.writeCsvValue(ts);\n                }\n            },\n            .labels => {\n                if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n                    const joined = try std.mem.join(self.allocator, \";\", issue.labels);\n                    defer self.allocator.free(joined);\n                    try self.writeCsvValue(joined);\n                }\n            },\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Write a CSV value with proper escaping.\n    fn writeCsvValue(self: *Self, value: []const u8) !void {\n        // Check if escaping is needed (contains comma, quote, or newline)\n        const needs_quoting = std.mem.indexOfAny(u8, value, \",\\\"\\n\\r\") != null;\n\n        if (needs_quoting) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\\"\");\n            for (value) |c| {\n                if (c == '\"') {\n                    try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\\"\\\"\");\n                } else {\n                    try self.stdout.writeAll(&[_]u8{c});\n                }\n            }\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\\"\");\n        } else {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(value);\n        }\n    }\n};\n\n// ============================================================================\n// Helper Functions\n// spec, only existence matters, not the value\n    return std.process.hasEnvVarConstant(\"NO_COLOR\");\n}\n\n/// Get ANSI color for a status.\nfn getStatusColor(status: Status) []const u8 {\n    return switch (status) {\n        .open => Color.green,\n        .in_progress => Color.yellow,\n        .blocked => Color.red,\n        .deferred => Color.gray,\n        .closed => Color.gray,\n        .tombstone => Color.dim,\n        .pinned => Color.bright_cyan,\n        .custom => Color.blue,\n    };\n}\n\n/// Get ANSI color for a priority.\nfn getPriorityColor(priority: Priority) []const u8 {\n    return switch (priority.value) {\n        0 => Color.bright_red, // critical\n        1 => Color.red, // high\n        2 => Color.yellow, // medium\n        3 => Color.green, // low\n        4 => Color.gray, // backlog\n        else => Color.reset,\n    };\n}\n\n/// Get short status abbreviation.\nfn abbreviateStatus(status: Status) []const u8 {\n    return switch (status) {\n        .open => \"OPEN\",\n        .in_progress => \"PROG\",\n        .blocked => \"BLKD\",\n        .deferred => \"DEFR\",\n        .closed => \"DONE\",\n        .tombstone => \"DEL \",\n        .pinned => \"PIN \",\n        .custom => \"CUST\",\n    };\n}\n\n/// Get priority indicator symbol.\nfn priorityIndicator(priority: Priority) []const u8 {\n    return switch (priority.value) {\n        0 => \"!!!\",\n        1 => \"!! \",\n        2 => \"!  \",\n        3 => \".  \",\n        4 => \"   \",\n        else => \"   \",\n    };\n}\n\n// };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with explicit mode (useful for testing).\n    pub fn initWithMode(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with silent mode (suppresses ALL output including errors).\n    pub fn initSilent(allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return Respects NO_COLOR environment variable and --no-color flag.\n\nconst std = @import(\"std\");\nconst models = @import(\"../models/mod.zig\");\nconst Issue = models.Issue;\nconst Status = basic formatting\n    rich, // Colors and formatting (TTY)\n    json, // Structured JSON output\n    quiet, // Minimal output (IDs only)\n};\n\n/// ANSI color escape codes.\npub const Color = struct {\n    pub const reset = \"\\x1b[0m\";\n    pub const bold = \"\\x1b[1m\";\n    pub const dim = \"\\x1b[2m\";\n    pub const italic = \"\\x1b[3m\";\n    pub const underline = \"\\x1b[4m\";\n\n    pub const red = \"\\x1b[31m\";\n    pub const green = \"\\x1b[32m\";\n    pub const yellow = \"\\x1b[33m\";\n    pub const blue = \"\\x1b[34m\";\n    pub const magenta = \"\\x1b[35m\";\n    pub const cyan = \"\\x1b[36m\";\n    pub const white = \"\\x1b[37m\";\n    pub const gray = \"\\x1b[90m\";\n\n    pub const bright_red = \"\\x1b[91m\";\n    pub const bright_green = \"\\x1b[92m\";\n    pub const bright_yellow = \"\\x1b[93m\";\n    pub const bright_blue = \"\\x1b[94m\";\n    pub const bright_magenta = \"\\x1b[95m\";\n    pub const bright_cyan = \"\\x1b[96m\";\n\n    pub const bg_red = \"\\x1b[41m\";\n    pub const bg_green = \"\\x1b[42m\";\n    pub const bg_yellow = \"\\x1b[43m\";\n    pub const bg_blue = \"\\x1b[44m\";\n};\n\n/// Global options that affect output formatting.\n/// This mirrors the relevant fields from cli.args.GlobalOptions.\npub const OutputOptions = struct {\n    json: bool = false,\n    toon: bool = false,\n    quiet: bool = false,\n    silent: bool = false, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    no_color: bool = false,\n    wrap: bool = false, // Wrap long lines in plain text output\n    stats: bool = false, // Show token savings stats for TOON output\n};\n\n/// Output formatter for consistent CLI output across all modes.\npub const Output = struct {\n    mode: OutputMode,\n    toon: bool,\n    silent: bool, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    wrap: bool, // Wrap long lines in plain text output\n    stats: bool, // Show token savings stats for TOON output\n    stdout: std.fs.File,\n    stderr: std.fs.File,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    /// Terminal width for line wrapping (default: 80)\n    terminal_width: usize = 80,\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Initialize output formatter based on global options and TTY detection.\n    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, opts: OutputOptions) Self {\n        const stdout = std.fs.File.stdout();\n        const stderr = std.fs.File.stderr();\n\n        var mode: OutputMode = .plain;\n        if (opts.json or opts.toon) {\n            mode = .json;\n        } else if (opts.quiet or opts.silent) {\n            mode = .quiet;\n        } else if (!opts.no_color and !checkNoColorEnv() and stdout.isTty()) {\n            mode = .rich;\n        }\n\n        // Try to get terminal width, default to 80\n        const terminal_width: usize = getTerminalWidth() orelse 80;\n\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = opts.toon,\n            .silent = opts.silent,\n            .wrap = opts.wrap,\n            .stats = opts.stats,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = terminal_width,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with explicit mode (useful for testing).\n    pub fn initWithMode(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = false,\n            .wrap = false,\n            .stats = false,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize for testing with custom file handles.\n    pub fn initForTesting(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode, stdout: std.fs.File, stderr: std.fs.File) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = false,\n            .wrap = false,\n            .stats = false,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with silent mode (suppresses ALL output including errors).\n    pub fn initSilent(allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = .quiet,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = true,\n            .wrap = false,\n            .stats = false,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Issue Display\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a single issue in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssue(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueJson(issue),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueQuiet(issue),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueRich(issue),\n            .plain => try self.printIssuePlain(issue),\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Print a list of issues in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssueList(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueListJson(issues),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueListQuiet(issues),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueListRich(issues),\n            .plain => try self.printIssueListPlain(issues),\n        }\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Generic Messages\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout.\n    pub fn print(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout with newline.\n    pub fn println(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt ++ \"\\n\", args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a success message (green in rich mode).\n    pub fn success(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.green);\n        const msg = try }\n\n    /// Print TOON format token savings statistics.\n    fn printToonStats(self: *Self, json_len: usize, toon_len: usize) !void {\n        // Estimate tokens using common approximation: ~4 chars try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n        }\n    }\n\n    fn printIssueListRich(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        for (issues) |issue| {\n            const status_color = ========================================================================\n\n    /// Available fields for CSV output.\n    pub const CsvField = enum {\n        id,\n        title,\n        status,\n .status;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"priority\")) return .priority;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"type\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"issue_type\")) return .issue_type;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"assignee\")) return .assignee;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"owner\")) return .owner;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"description\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, return .labels;\n            return null;\n        }\n\n        pub fn toString(self: CsvField) []const u8 {\n            return switch (self) {\n                .id => \"id\",\n                .title => \"title\",\n                .status => \"status\",\n                .priority => \"priority\",\n                .issue_type => \"type\",\n                .assignee => \"assignee\",\n .priority };\n\n    /// Parse a comma-separated field list into CsvField array.\n    pub fn parseCsvFields(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, fields_str: ?[]const u8) ![]const CsvField {\n        if be freed by the caller.\nfn wrapText(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, text: []const u8, width: usize, indent: usize) ![]const u8 {\n    if (width <= indent) return allocator.dupe(u8, text);\n\n    var result = std.ArrayList(u8).init(allocator);\n    errdefer result.deinit();\n\n    var line_start: usize = 0;\n    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n    var current_width: usize = 0;\n    const 1]);\n            if (i + 1 < text.len) {\n                try result.appendNTimes(' ', indent);\n            }\n            line_start = i + 1;\n            last_space = null;\n            current_width = 0;\n            continue;\n        }\n\n        if (c == ' ') {\n            last_space = i;\n        }\n\n        current_width += 1;\n\n        if (current_width > effective_width) last_space = null;\n            } else {\n                // No space to wrap at, force break\n                try result.appendSlice(text[line_start..i]);\n                try result.append('\\n');\n (line_start < text.len) {\n        try result.appendSlice(text[line_start..]);\n    }\n\n    return result.toOwnedSlice();\n}\n\n/// Check if NO_COLOR environment variable is set (cross-platform).\nfn \"\\x1b[41m\";\n    pub const bg_green = \"\\x1b[42m\";\n    pub const bg_yellow = \"\\x1b[43m\";\n    pub const bg_blue = \"\\x1b[44m\";\n};\n\n/// Global options that affect output formatting.\n/// // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    no_color: bool = false,\n    wrap: bool = false, // Wrap long lines in plain text output\n    stats: bool = false, // Show token savings stats for TOON output\n};\n\n/// Output formatter for consistent CLI output across all modes.\npub const Output = struct {\n    mode: OutputMode,\n    toon: bool,\n    silent: bool, // Suppress ALL output std.fs.File,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    /// Terminal width for line wrapping (default: 80)\n    terminal_width: usize = 80,\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Initialize output .quiet;\n        } else if (!opts.no_color and !checkNoColorEnv() and stdout.isTty()) {\n            mode = .rich;\n        }\n\n        // Try to get terminal width, default to 80\n        const };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with explicit mode (useful for testing).\n    pub fn initWithMode(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with silent mode (suppresses ALL output including errors).\n    pub fn initSilent(allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return }\n\n    /// Print TOON format token savings statistics.\n    fn printToonStats(self: *Self, json_len: usize, toon_len: usize) !void {\n        // Estimate tokens using common approximation: ~4 chars .status;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"priority\")) return .priority;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"type\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"issue_type\")) return .issue_type;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"assignee\")) return .assignee;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"owner\")) return .owner;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"description\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, be freed by the caller.\nfn wrapText(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, text: []const u8, width: usize, indent: usize) ![]const u8 {\n    if (width <= indent) return allocator.dupe(u8, text);\n\n    var result = std.ArrayList(u8).init(allocator);\n    errdefer result.deinit();\n\n    var line_start: usize = 0;\n    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n    var current_width: usize = 0;\n    const 1]);\n            if (i + 1 < text.len) {\n                try result.appendNTimes(' ', indent);\n            }\n            line_start = i + 1;\n            last_space = null;\n            current_width = 0;\n            continue;\n        }\n\n        if (c == ' ') {\n            last_space = i;\n        }\n\n        current_width += 1;\n\n        if (current_width > effective_width) {\n            // Need to wrap\n            if (last_space) |space_pos| {\n                // Wrap at last space\n                try result.appendSlice(text[line_start..space_pos]);\n                try result.append('\\n');\n                try result.appendNTimes(' ', indent);\n                line_start = space_pos + 1;\n                current_width = i - space_pos;\n                last_space = null;\n            } else {\n                // No space to wrap at, force break\n                try result.appendSlice(text[line_start..i]);\n                try result.append('\\n');\n (line_start < text.len) {\n        try result.appendSlice(text[line_start..]);\n    }\n\n    return result.toOwnedSlice();\n}\n\n/// Check if NO_COLOR environment variable is set (cross-platform).\nfn (json_tokens > toon_tokens)\n            ((json_tokens - toon_tokens) * 100) / json_tokens\n        else\n            0;\n\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(\n            self.allocator,\n            \"# Token savings: {d}% ({d} -> {d} tokens)\\n\",\n            .{ savings_pct, json_tokens, toon_tokens },\n        );\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try  }\n        if (issue.labels.len > 0) {\n            try self.stdout.writeAll(\"Labels: \");\n            for (issue.labels, 0..) |label, i| {\n                if (i > 0) try self.stdout.writeAll(\", ========================================================================\n    // CSV Mode Helpers\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Available fields for CSV output.\n    pub const CsvField = enum {\n        id,\n        title,\n        status,\n        priority,\n        issue_type,\n        assignee,\n        owner,\n        description,\n        created_at,\n        updated_at,\n        due_at,\n        labels,\n\n        pub fn fromString(s: []const u8) ?CsvField {\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"id\")) return .id;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"title\")) return .title;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"status\")) return .status;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"priority\")) return .priority;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"type\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"issue_type\")) return .issue_type;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"assignee\")) return .assignee;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"owner\")) return .owner;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"description\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"desc\")) return .description;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"created_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"created\")) return .created_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"updated_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"updated\")) return .updated_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"due_at\") or std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"due\")) return .due_at;\n            if (std.mem.eql(u8, s, \"labels\")) return .labels;\n            return null;\n        }\n\n        pub fn toString(self: CsvField) []const u8 {\n            return switch (self) {\n                .id => \"id\",\n                .title => \"title\",\n                .status => \"status\",\n                .priority => \"priority\",\n                .issue_type => \"type\",\n                .assignee => \"assignee\",\n                .owner => \"owner\",\n                .description => \"description\",\n };\n\n    /// Default fields for CSV output.\n    pub const default_csv_fields = [_]CsvField{ .id, .title, .status, .priority };\n\n    /// Parse a comma-separated field list into CsvField array.\n    pub fn parseCsvFields(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, fields_str: ?[]const u8) ![]const CsvField {\n        if (fields_str) |str| {\n            var fields: std.ArrayListUnmanaged(CsvField) = .{};\n /// Print a list of issues in CSV format.\n    pub fn printIssueListCsv(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue, fields: []const CsvField) !void {\n        // Write header\n        for (fields, 0..) width from ioctl or COLUMNS env var.\nfn getTerminalWidth() ?usize {\n    // Try ioctl first (POSIX)\n    if (@import(\"builtin\").os.tag != .windows) {\n        const stdout_fd = std.posix.STDOUT_FILENO;\n        var winsize: std.posix.winsize = undefined;\n        const result = std.posix.system.ioctl(stdout_fd, std.posix.T.IOCGWINSZ, @intFromPtr(&winsize));\n        if |_| {}\n    return null;\n}\n\n/// Wrap text to fit within a given width, preserving word boundaries.\n/// Returns allocated memory that must be freed by the caller.\nfn wrapText(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, text: []const u8, width: usize, indent: usize) ![]const u8 {\n    if (width <= indent) return allocator.dupe(u8, text);\n\n    var result = std.ArrayList(u8).init(allocator);\n    errdefer result.deinit();\n\n    var line_start: usize = 0;\n    var last_space: ?usize = null;\n    var current_width: usize = 0;\n    const effective_width = width - indent;\n\n    for (text, 0..) |c, i| {\n        if (c == '\\n') {\n            // Preserve existing newlines\n            try result.appendSlice(text[line_start .. i + 1]);\n            if (i + 1 < text.len) {\n                try result.appendNTimes(' ', indent);\n            }\n            line_start = i + 1;\n            last_space = null;\n            current_width = 0;\n            continue;\n        }\n\n        if (c == ' ') {\n            last_space = i;\n        }\n\n        current_width += 1;\n\n        if (current_width > effective_width) {\n            // Need to wrap\n            if (last_space) |space_pos| {\n                // Wrap at last space\n                try result.appendSlice(text[line_start..space_pos]);\n                try result.append('\\n');\n                try result.appendNTimes(' ', indent);\n                line_start = space_pos + 1;\n                current_width = i - space_pos;\n                last_space = null;\n            } else {\n                // No space to wrap at, force break\n                try result.appendSlice(text[line_start..i]);\n                try result.append('\\n');\n                try result.appendNTimes(' ', indent);\n                line_start = i;\n                current_width = 1;\n            }\n        }\n    }\n\n    // Append remaining text\n    if (line_start < text.len) {\n        try result.appendSlice(text[line_start..]);\n    }\n\n    return result.toOwnedSlice();\n}\n\n/// Check if NO_COLOR environment variable is set (cross-platform).\nfn checkNoColorEnv() bool {\n    // Per NO_COLOR spec, only existence matters, not the basic formatting\n    rich, // Colors and formatting (TTY)\n    json, // Structured JSON output\n    quiet, // Minimal output (IDs only)\n};\n\n/// ANSI color escape codes.\npub const Color = struct bright_yellow = \"\\x1b[93m\";\n    pub const bright_blue = \"\\x1b[94m\";\n    pub const bright_magenta = \"\\x1b[95m\";\n    pub const bright_cyan = \"\\x1b[96m\";\n\n    pub const bg_red = This mirrors the relevant fields from cli.args.GlobalOptions.\npub const OutputOptions = struct {\n    json: bool = false,\n    toon: bool = false,\n    quiet: bool = false,\n    silent: bool = false, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    no_color: bool = false,\n    wrap: bool = false, // Wrap long lines in plain text output\n    stats: bool = false, // Show token savings stats for TOON output\n};\n\n/// Output formatter for consistent CLI output across all modes.\npub const Output = struct {\n    mode: OutputMode,\n    toon: bool,\n    silent: bool, // Suppress ALL output including errors (for tests)\n    wrap: bool, // Wrap long lines in plain text output\n    stats: bool, // Show token savings stats for TOON output\n    stdout: std.fs.File,\n    stderr: std.fs.File,\n    allocator: std.mem.Allocator,\n    /// Terminal width for line wrapping (default: 80)\n    terminal_width: usize = 80,\n\n    const Self = @This();\n\n    /// Initialize output formatter based on global options and TTY detection.\n    pub fn init(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, opts: OutputOptions) Self {\n        const stdout = std.fs.File.stdout();\n        const stderr = std.fs.File.stderr();\n\n        var mode: OutputMode = .plain;\n        if (opts.json or opts.toon) {\n            mode = .json;\n        } else if (opts.quiet or opts.silent) {\n            mode = .quiet;\n        } else if (!opts.no_color and !checkNoColorEnv() and stdout.isTty()) {\n            mode = .rich;\n        }\n\n        // Try to get terminal width, default to 80\n        const terminal_width: usize = getTerminalWidth() orelse 80;\n\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = opts.toon,\n            .silent = opts.silent,\n            .wrap = opts.wrap,\n            .stats = opts.stats,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = terminal_width,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with explicit mode (useful for testing).\n    pub fn initWithMode(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = false,\n            .wrap = false,\n            .stats = false,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize for testing with custom file handles.\n    pub fn initForTesting(allocator: std.mem.Allocator, mode: OutputMode, stdout: std.fs.File, stderr: std.fs.File) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = mode,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = false,\n            .wrap = false,\n            .stats = false,\n            .stdout = stdout,\n            .stderr = stderr,\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    /// Initialize with silent mode (suppresses ALL output including errors).\n    pub fn initSilent(allocator: std.mem.Allocator) Self {\n        return .{\n            .mode = .quiet,\n            .toon = false,\n            .silent = true,\n            .wrap = false,\n            .stats = false,\n            .stdout = std.fs.File.stdout(),\n            .stderr = std.fs.File.stderr(),\n            .allocator = allocator,\n            .terminal_width = 80,\n        };\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // Issue Display\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a single issue in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssue(self: *Self, issue: Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueJson(issue),\n            .quiet => try self.printIssueQuiet(issue),\n            .rich => try self.printIssueRich(issue),\n            .plain => try self.printIssuePlain(issue),\n        }\n    }\n\n    /// Print a list of issues in the appropriate format.\n    pub fn printIssueList(self: *Self, issues: []const Issue) !void {\n        switch (self.mode) {\n            .json => try self.printIssueListJson(issues),\n // ========================================================================\n    // Generic Messages\n    // ========================================================================\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout.\n    pub fn print(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    /// Print a formatted message to stdout with newline.\n    pub fn println(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, fmt ++ \"\\n\", self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an error message to stderr (red in rich mode).\n    pub fn err(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.silent) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.red);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"error: \" ++ fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print a warning message to stderr (yellow in rich mode).\n    pub fn warn(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.silent or self.mode == .quiet) return;\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.yellow);\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(self.allocator, \"warning: \" ++ fmt, args);\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stderr.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print an info message (cyan in rich mode).\n    pub fn info(self: *Self, comptime fmt: []const u8, args: anytype) !void {\n        if (self.mode == self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(msg);\n        if (self.mode == .rich) try self.stdout.writeAll(Color.reset);\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(\"\\n\");\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw bytes to stdout (bypasses mode checks).\n    pub fn raw(self: *Self, bytes: []const u8) !void {\n        try self.stdout.writeAll(bytes);\n    }\n\n    /// Print raw JSON value to stdout (for JSON mode).\n    /// If toon mode is enabled, converts JSON to TOON format for reduced token usage.\n    /// If stats mode is also enabled, displays token savings information.\n    pub fn printJson(self: *Self, value: anytype) !void {\n        const json_bytes = try std.json.Stringify.valueAlloc(self.allocator, value, .{});\n        defer self.allocator.free(json_bytes);\n\n        if }\n\n    /// Print TOON format token savings statistics.\n    fn printToonStats(self: *Self, json_len: usize, toon_len: usize) !void {\n        // Estimate tokens using common approximation: ~4 chars per token\n        const json_tokens = (json_len + 3) / 4;\n        const toon_tokens = (toon_len + 3) / 4;\n\n        if (json_tokens == 0) return;\n\n        const savings_pct: usize = if (json_tokens > toon_tokens)\n            ((json_tokens - toon_tokens) * 100) / json_tokens\n        else\n            0;\n\n        const msg = try std.fmt.allocPrint(\n            self.allocator,\n            \"# Token savings: {d}% ({d} -> {d} tokens)\\n\",\n            .{ savings_pct, json_tokens, toon_tokens },\n        );\n        defer self.allocator.free(msg);\n        try self.stderr.writeAll(msg);\n    }\n\n    // ========================================================================\n    // JSON Mode Helpers\n    //
